lead_paragraph: Oscar De La Hoya said yesterday he would not fight this year but hinted strongly that he would fight one last time next May against the unbeaten Floyd Mayweather Jr. De La Hoya had to make some decision on his future plans because a proposed Sept. 16 date loomed for a fight against Mayweather that could be the richest nonheavyweight fight in history.
